main event: An unidentified round silver object was sighted over Lynchburg, Virginia on June 19, 1952.
interesting points: The object was reported to have no exhaust trail and was moving at a very high altitude and speed towards Madison Heights,The sighting occurred at 1444Z, coinciding with a balloon release earlier that day,Multiple reports were made by witnesses including someone with WWII anti-aircraft experience, Piedmont Airline Flight 30 was in the vicinity but did not report seeing the object, Langley AFB sent a fighter aircraft for reconnaissance after receiving the sighting report.
witness description: Mr. [REDACTED], who was at the Virginia Episcopal School and had anti-aircraft experience in WWII.
